posts.author: Richelieu
posts.content:
Arelith lvl30 Orog Battle Cleric.

Arelith server - level cap at 30, low magic (assume no magic equipmment), no dev. crit., no HiPS, multiclass dips must be 3 levels minimum. Only weapons with no properties on them can have a spell cast on them and you can only cast one enchantment per item. (so if you cast GMW then you can not cast darkfire).

Orog stats - +2 Str, +2 Con, -2 Int, -2 Cha, -2 Wis
Half orc base race
Favoured class - fighter (ignore xp considerations)

Character functions/abilities (in order of preferance) -

Party Buff
Self Buff
Combat
subterfuge (locks, traps, stealth, I'm thinking a few rogue lvls)
summoning
Healing

Domains - Travel, Trickery (open to suggestions)

Feats - i would like to see your suggestions for all feats, however, I would also like to see what you think are the three least important of your suggested feats... with a view to possibly taking epic enchantment focus.

I know this is hardly going to be an optimised build (cleric with -2 wisdom!) but I am looking forward to seeing what you can come up with.

Thanks in advance.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Richelieu wrote:
Arelith server - level cap at 30, low magic (assume no magic equipmment), no dev. crit., no HiPS, multiclass dips must be 3 levels minimum.
The way this has been explained by other Arelith players is that the new class levels must be taken in sequence and once you've gained the 3, there is no longer a minimum for dump (i.e. dip?). So a progression like: dru1/mnk1/mnk2/mnk3/dru2/dru3/mnk4/dru4 is perfectly legal. True or not? Does it go for both the starting class and added classes or just the added classes? It is important to have this made very clear for those of the guild not familiar with Arelith's house rules. Tx.

BTW, Welcome to the new ECB!

posts.author: Richelieu
posts.content:
Ahh yes. You are correct. Each NEW class must be taken for three consecutive levels. Thereafter levels can be taken as you like. This also applies to the character's initial class.

For example, a cleric / rogue / monk could be built as follows,

R1, R2, R3, C1, C2, C3, C4, R4, C5, C6, C7.... C16, M1, M2, M3, C17, C18, R5, M4, C19.. etc

(Edit.The progression you give above is not legal, as the first three druid levels are not consecutive.)

posts.author: Richelieu
posts.content: Oh, and you must be able to take at least three levels of each class, so you cannot take cleric for levels 1-29 and then add a level of monk.

posts.content:

Okie doke. Will make a stab at it in the next few days so check back from time to time. I'll need some help getting your custom race/class abilities to work out (only familiar with half-orc +2 STR/-2 INT/-2 CHA) but we can address that after a build has been displayed. The favored class looks like it was changed from barb (vanilla) to fighter (Arelith) as well but that is easy to plan out. I'll tentatively assume you are looking for a STR build so I can hash something out quickly.

posts.author: Richelieu
posts.content:
Great! Thanks, I look forward to seeing what you come up with.

Just to be clear, the stats I gave for Orog include the half orc base race stats, so taking Half Orc gives the usual +2 Str, -2 Int, -2 Chr, and then taking Orog gives an additional -2 Wis +2 Con. I believe these are hard changes so they are like normal racial stat bonuses and do not count to the +12 limit.

As for the favoured class.. I really dont mind taking any experience point loss from multiclassing so do not make that a big factor in the build.

Also, A Strength build would be awesome!, however, I failed to mention previously that RDD will not be available.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
No room to consider RDD in a 30-level cap build so I never considered it.

This is the first attempt to satisfy your preferences list. There are 3 total to compare. XP penalty of some degree will be inherited in each unless you go with pure cleric/fighter.

In this one, rogue can't be used unless you choose a tertiary class to max discipline... IMO crucial to the success of this build (how ya gonna buff folks if KD'd?). Bard satisfies somewhat to make a slightly more skillful variant than the others which will follow shortly. The trickery skills can only be used 1x/day so if that is ok by you, go to it. (I would prefer Strength domain myself to open up a few more DPs. ) War domain is pretty much essential to make this work. It is counter-productive to try to make a fully-fledged stealther with this race. Need to build DEX-based, weapon-finessed, and the split between DEX/INT/WIS will be prohibitive with buffs that are quite dispellable... overall a very weak build just to sneak around non-True Seers. Check it out, but don't rush out to try it until you see the others. It's main purpose was to get your grey matter activated! *lol*
